intro: Schizotheca patula, commonly known as the narrowleaf thistle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its spiny leaves and purple to pink flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Schizotheca patula plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
